author: V Venkatasubramanian
text:
There was palpable tension at District Government Headquarters Hospital here on Wednesday, as the post-mortem examination of the body of an engineering student was being carried out.

According to the police, the Sriperumpudur police on Monday night received information that Ajithkumar, a second-year engineering student of St. Joseph College of Engineering, Nemili, Beemanthangal, near Sriperumpudur, had hanged himself in his hostel room.

The police rushed to the college and removed the body. A case of death under suspicious circumstances was booked and the body was sent to District Government Headquarters Hospital.

When the Sriperumpudur police made arrangements for the post-mortem examination on Tuesday, the move was thwarted by some groups. As a result, the inquest was rescheduled for Wednesday.

On Wednesday morning, a large number of people gathered on the hospital premises and raised slogans demanding justice. They alleged that Ajithkumar had been driven to the extreme step by the college management as it had ill-treated him on the basis of his performance in semester examinations.

They demanded a huge sum of money as compensation for the deceased student’s family. In view of the demonstration, the student’s family could not receive Ajithkumar’s body for cremation till evening, the police added. Preliminary inquiry states that Ajithkumar, son of Gnanamani, Allur village, Chidambaram taluk, Cuddalore district, was pursuing Civil Engineering at the college. He had not cleared some of the papers in the two semester examinations held in the first year and also failed to clear some papers in the third-semester examination in November 2015, the police added.
title: Student suicide: post-mortem conducted
